macroscript.actions

Class MouseOperator

  • java.lang.Object
    • macroscript.actions.MouseOperator

  • public class MouseOperator
extends Object
    The mouse functions are executed here.
    Author:
    Joonas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MouseOperator()
      The constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void leftClick()
      Simulates a mouse left click.
      void leftDown()
      Simulates a mouse left button down event.
      void leftHumanClick()
      Simulates a mouse left click with random Thread.sleep() intervals before left down event, in between of left down and left up events and after left down event.
      void leftUp()
      Simulates a mouse left button up event.
      void moveMouseHuman(int x, int y, int steps, int arch)
      Moves the cursor using a curvy route to get to the given coordinates.
      void moveMouseSmooth(int x, int y, int delay)
      Moves the cursor pixel by pixel to the given coordinates using the shortest path availible.
      void rightClick()
      Simulates a mouse right click.
      void rightDown()
      Simulates a mouse right button down event.
      void rightHumanClick()
      Simulates a mouse right click with random Thread.sleep() intervals before left down event, in between of left down and left up events and after left down event.
      void rightUp()
      Simulates a mouse right button up event.
      void setMousePosition(int x, int y)
      Sets the cursor position immediately to gives coordinates.

      • setMousePosition

        public void setMousePosition(int x,
                             int y)
        Sets the cursor position immediately to gives coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal target coordinate
        y - The vertical target coordinate

      • moveMouseSmooth

        public void moveMouseSmooth(int x,
                            int y,
                            int delay)
        Moves the cursor pixel by pixel to the given coordinates using the shortest path availible. Can only move either horizontally, vertically or diagonally, where delta x and delta y both equal one pixel.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal target coordinate
        y - The vertical target coordinate
        delay - The delay in ms between each move

      • moveMouseHuman

        public void moveMouseHuman(int x,
                           int y,
                           int steps,
                           int arch)
        Moves the cursor using a curvy route to get to the given coordinates. Also skips pixels inbetween moves, simulating normal cursor behaviour.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal target coordinate
        y - The vertical target coordinate
        steps - The amount of steps that will be used to reach the target coordinates
        arch - Determines the boldness of the curves that will become the route to reach the target coordinates
